item.title: Updating Office Playbook: Revisiting Self-Management Skills
item.description: Today marks the second month of working from home initiative. My takeaway is: “It is mentally draining and hard to keep yourself motivated”. Some people have this as their regular routine, but most people, myself included, are required to develop a new set of self-management skills to keep our productivity in check. Here are some of the main topic that I get to identify by this experience: 1. It’s hard to keep track of the priorities Required skill: Better personal timetable design All information seems to come spontaneously due to the sense of “flexibility” in the working hours.

item.title: COVID-19 Transmission
item.description: Preface This content is created for educational purposes, shout out to louislugas from GitHub for the content inspiration. Check out his awesome web application for COVID-19 transmission network analysis. This article will focus on breaking down building blocks in creating network analysis taking on the most recent COVID-19 pandemic outbreak in Indonesia. There are exponentially rising amount of suspects and patients on this matter and a strategic approach in containing the spread will be required in decision makings in this country.

item.title: Hi.
item.description: You seems to have discovered my site The time I’m writing this, the website is not planned to be publicly announced. This is my first trial in publishing a personal website. I am currently teaching data science and building stuff at Algoritma. I enjoy fiddling with data and codes (a bit of coding with a lot of praying and googling). The handsome avatar in the top left you are looking right now is Bolin, my cat, please shower him with lots of love.
